attributes.action: Reconsider the removal of the 10% tax rate without appropriate mitigation to protect the lowest paid workers
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The current disagreements could be equitably resolved by 

(a) increasing the personal allowance by £300 making the effect neutral.

(b) mitigating the circa £2.5 billion cost to the public purse by increasing the NI contribution level of the higher rate tax payer to compensate.

The petitioner is a higher rate tax payer; and would be happy to meet the deficit as an equitable solution as would may others.

The alternative is to leave many millions of British worker unfairly treated in a prosperous society.

At the appropriate time once the current liquidity crisis has subsided; it would be appropriate to call the financial market to account for their call on the tax payer as lender at last resort and to be as generous as they are to their own in rewarding the tax payer for stepping up to the mark.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
